metadata.title: CVE-2023-28327 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the UNIX protocol innet/unix/diag.c In unix_diag_get_exact in the Linux Kernel. The newlyallocated skb does not have sk, leading to a NULL pointer. This flaw allowsa local user to crash or potentially cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
